description:
If eventlet monkeypatches everything, oswaitpid breaks as mentioned here:
https://bitbucket.org/which_linden/eventlet/issue/92/eventletgreen-override-of-oswaitpid

To see this in action in current nova change this line in wsgi.py:

 42 eventlet.patcher.monkey_patch(socket=True, time=True)

to this:

 42 eventlet.monkey_patch()

When you start nova-api, the main thread will exit immediately, leaving two forked child threads. I think the best solution here is to use greenthreads everywhere instead of special casing nova-api to use multiprocessing.
title: eventlet and multiprocessing causes failure in oswaitpid

comments.content:
By the way, why do we need to monkey patch 'os' module for nova?

I don't think that it is a good idea to use greenthreads to start the multiple WSGI servers. The drawback of using greenthread instead of multiporcessing is that, we will experience a very inefficient response from the two WSGI servers (NOVA & EC2) on average. Instead, we should start them using multiprocessing so that we can exploit multiple CPU cores. It is just my opinion

Thanks.

Ahmad
Hewlett-Packard
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ahmad-hassan-q

comments.content:
This is a recipe for really annoying bugs.  There are just a lot of weird interactions between eventlet, multiprocessing and signals that have led to hard to find errors.  If you want better performance on multiple cores just start the servers separately via:
nova-api-ec2 / nova-api-os-compute / nova-api-os-volume

Vish
